ticket.title: [PATCH] scoped translation throws an exception
ticket.original-body: If I have a view that is localized, (eg. home#index.zh.html) and I still have a t() helper then in fails to translate relative keys. Example: t('.header') => "zh, home, index, zh, header" instead of t('.header') => "ZH Header" It looks like it is including the 'zh' when figuring out the path therefore it fails to find the translation. The method 'path_without_format_and_extension' seems to return the locale so maybe it should use a new method that doesn't include the locale (eg. path_without_format_and_extension_and_locale).
ticket.latest-body: If I have a view that is localized, (eg. home#index.zh.html) and I still have a t() helper then in fails to translate relative keys. Example: t('.header') => "zh, home, index, zh, header" instead of t('.header') => "ZH Header" It looks like it is including the 'zh' when figuring out the path therefore it fails to find the translation. The method 'path_without_format_and_extension' seems to return the locale so maybe it should use a new method that doesn't include the locale (eg. path_without_format_and_extension_and_locale).
ticket.original-body-html:
If I have a view that is localized, (eg. home#index.zh.html) and I still have a t() helper then in fails to translate relative keys.

Example: t('.header') => "zh, home, index, zh, header" instead of t('.header') => "ZH Header"

It looks like it is including the 'zh' when figuring out the path therefore it fails to find the translation. The method 'path_without_format_and_extension' seems to return the locale so maybe it should use a new method that doesn't include the locale (eg. path_without_format_and_extension_and_locale).

version.body: If I have a view that is localized, (eg. home#index.zh.html) and I still have a t() helper then in fails to translate relative keys. Example: t('.header') => "zh, home, index, zh, header" instead of t('.header') => "ZH Header" It looks like it is including the 'zh' when figuring out the path therefore it fails to find the translation. The method 'path_without_format_and_extension' seems to return the locale so maybe it should use a new method that doesn't include the locale (eg. path_without_format_and_extension_and_locale).
version.body-html:
If I have a view that is localized, (eg. home#index.zh.html) and I still have a t() helper then in fails to translate relative keys.

Example:
t('.header') => "zh, home, index, zh, header"
instead of
t('.header') => "ZH Header"

It looks like it is including the 'zh' when figuring out the path therefore it fails to find the translation. The method 'path_without_format_and_extension' seems to return the locale so maybe it should use a new method that doesn't include the locale (eg. path_without_format_and_extension_and_locale).
version.title: translation helper fails in localized views

version.body:
This is really broken in Rails 3 due to the Action View refactoring. The test continues to pass because of a stub but when trying to use scoped keys, a call to the removed path_without_format_and_extension causes an error.
I guess we'll have to patch the translation helper to do its own parsing of template.identifier to support scoped keys in the 3. Any thoughts?
version.body-html:
This is really broken in Rails 3 due to the Action View refactoring. The test continues to pass because of a stub but when trying to use scoped keys, a call to the removed path_without_format_and_extension causes an error.

I guess we'll have to patch the translation helper to do its own parsing of template.identifier to support scoped keys in the 3. Any thoughts?
version.title: translation helper fails in localized views

version.body: To clarify the above - this is verified in 2-3-stable, and even worse in master as translation_helper hasn't been refactored to be in step with the new Action View code.
version.body-html: To clarify the above - this is verified in 2-3-stable, and even worse in master as translation_helper hasn't been refactored to be in step with the new Action View code.
version.diffable-attributes: --- :tag: i18n :title: translation helper fails in localized views
version.title: scoped translation throws an exception

version.body: Here's my attempt at a fix. I've added the details previously accessible in path_without_format_and_extension by the translation helper to the new details hash.
version.body-html: Here's my attempt at a fix. I've added the details previously accessible in path_without_format_and_extension by the translation helper to the new details hash.
version.title: scoped translation throws an exception

version.body: Here's a patch to fix the more minor problem of scoped translations not working in localized views on 2.3.3.
version.body-html: Here's a patch to fix the more minor problem of scoped translations not working in localized views on 2.3.3.
version.title: [PATCH] scoped translation throws an exception

version.body:
The patch for rails3 doesn't apply (anymore). The `template` Variable seems to be always `nil`. As a fix for this I changed a line in `action_view/render/rendering.rb`:
@@@ ruby def render_template(options) _evaluate_assigns_and_ivars #template, layout, partial = options.values_at(:_template, :_layout, :_partial) self.template, layout, partial = options.values_at(:_template, :_layout, :_partial) _render_template(template, layout, options, partial) end @@@
But then the `scope_key_by_partial` method in `translation_helper.rb` returns a localization key with double periods ("..") in it.
version.body-html:
The patch for rails3 doesn't apply (anymore). The template Variable seems to be always nil. As a fix for this I changed a line in action_view/render/rendering.rb:

    def render_template(options)
      _evaluate_assigns_and_ivars
      #template, layout, partial = options.values_at(:_template, :_layout, :_partial)
      self.template, layout, partial = options.values_at(:_template, :_layout, :_partial)
      _render_template(template, layout, options, partial)
    end

But then the scope_key_by_partial method in translation_helper.rb returns a localization key with double periods ("..") in it.
version.title: [PATCH] scoped translation throws an exception

version.body: Marking ticket as stale. If this is still an issue please leave a comment with suggested changes, creating a patch with tests, rebasing an existing patch or just confirming the issue on a latest release or master/branches.
version.body-html: Marking ticket as stale. If this is still an issue please leave a comment with suggested changes, creating a patch with tests, rebasing an existing patch or just confirming the issue on a latest release or master/branches.
